info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 11:24PM EDT until April 9 at 3:42AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Anderson.
.Minor flooding has developed near Anderson along the White River due to recent heavy rain. Flooding is expected to continue into at least early next week due to additional rounds of heavy rainfall. Additional rainfall of two to four inches is possible.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Anderson.
* WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood waters close Edgewood Park and Grand Avenue between Alexandria Pike and Broadway. If river is rising at this level, the City of Anderson notifies residents along Hazlett Street, near W 1st Street and Madison Avenue, near W 2nd Street and Sycamore Street, and along Riverside Drive to prepare for sandbagging operations and possible evacuations.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EDT Thursday was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall early Saturday afternoon. It will rise to 13.3 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Friday afternoon by around 230 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING
